types.html:
pleure-pain m (plural pleure-pain)

  1. (obsolete) a miser, especially one who withholds food from themselves or others
    • 1617, Jacques Olivier, Alphabet de l'imperfection et malice des femmes‎[1]:
      C'est un pleure-pain qui a regret de manger son bien pour vivre, […]
      Such a Pinch-belly, that he grudgeth himself sustenance,
trans: a miser, especially one who withholds food from themselves or others
